Expectation1: Ensure client satisfaction and address any concerns or complaints professionally
Situation1: An easygoing regular politely asks for a tiny adjustment to their fringe.
Expectation2: Leading the daily prayers in the mosque
Situation2: The regular backup is away, so most congregants expect him to step forward for the scheduled prayer.
Story: I was halfway through trimming Mrs. Rahim’s fringe when she peered into the mirror and smiled, “Could you just take a little more off here?” She’s been coming to my salon for years, always cheerful, always trusting. I nodded, comb in hand, but my phone buzzed in my pocket—a message from the mosque committee. The regular backup imam was out sick, and the congregation was gathering, expecting me to lead the prayer in just fifteen minutes. My heart thudded. Mrs. Rahim deserved my full attention, her satisfaction was my pride as a hairdresser. But as an imam, I knew the community relied on me, especially today. I glanced at the clock, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in. My hands trembled slightly as I lifted the scissors, torn between the gentle trust in Mrs. Rahim’s eyes and the silent expectation of the waiting congregation.
